wikipedia_page.main: Nigel M. Bell (born 2 December 1962), also known by the nicknames of "Belly", "Bell Boy" and "ol' Nige", is an English former professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1980s and 1990s. He played at club level for Eastmoor Dragons ARLFC (of the National Conference League/Pennine League/Yorkshire Men's League, in Eastmoor, Wakefield), and Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 929) (captain), as a utility player, i.e. either in the backs, or forwards.

response: * Nigel Bell, Chief Executive of the NHS Information Authority from 1999-2001 (1970-7)
